prompt:
Please expand on the '{prompt}' in small paragraphs in shuddh hindi(at least 50 words in each paragraph using

tag in html). use bullet points using

  • where neccessary to illustrate things clrearly. Keep a total response output of 500 words.
label: Explain in Hindi
description: This prompt translates the provided content or explanation into Hindi.

prompt:
Explain {prompt} through Examples:

Instructions: In your response, please provide verifiable and factual information only, based on existing knowledge and understanding. Share details in no less than 300 words and try to use bullet points in HTML. Provide urls where you can.  Format the examples in HTML for better readability.
label: Give me examples
description: This prompt provides relevant examples to illustrate the concept or topic.

prompt:
In no less than 200 words explain this {prompt} using Socratic questioning method teach me using questions and answers. You have to be factually correct. INSTRUCTION: '''

Question No. 1: [Give me the question]

Answer: [Give me the the answer.(use

    and
  • list) ]

    ''' Provide urls where you can. Only give a response. Dont talk to me.
label: Socratic Questioning
description: This prompt employs a method of asking a series of questions to stimulate critical thinking and illuminate ideas.

prompt:
Use the {prompt} as a base to identify an actual event and key milestones, and explain to me in a very structured manner, using a story using evidences, traces of further leads, and fun & trivia stuff, on the sidelines. of the conversation You can get creative on the {prompt} but stay factual. You may elaborate, align and redefine the {prompt} but dont lose the context. I want to learn more about it. Give your ouput in html only and only give your output not background or summary required.

Provide urls where you can. Only give a response. Dont talk to me.
label: Story based learning
description: This prompt explains the concept through a narrative or story, making it easier to understand.

prompt:
Using a case study based learning on this {prompt}, Give me some quick and some detailed case studies in

tags. Give at least 3. Use bullet points as headers in tags. and write small paragraphs on each.write everything in html format)
label: Case study based learning
description: This prompt presents a detailed analysis of a real-life situation or problem to explore the concept in context.

prompt:
Learn all about this {prompt} in good technical and analytical detail for an expert. INSTRUCTION: '''

Description: [Key description of the {prompt} ]

How it works: [Explain the inner workings of it using key information and components(use

    and
  • list)]

    Reasoning: [point out important concepts required to reason through this {prompt} in bullet points(use

      and
    • list)]

      Cause and Effect: [list out the why, what, when and the prerequisites, causes, effect and causality of the events in {prompt}(use

        and
      • list)]

        ''' Please give a response in html like format Result:
label: Learn as an Expert
description: When you figure that the user wants to expand on this and wants to know about something in detail like an expert would, then use this prompt

prompt:
What is {prompt}. Tell me about the '{prompt}' using neccessary details like a 15 year old would be able to understand. Keep the language simple and easy to understand; and step by step. Follow given structure INSTRUCTION: '''

About: [Explain with an example what is it about.

How it works:[Tell me about how this works, what it leads to, what are the prerequisites, feedback loop etc.(use

    and
  • list) ]

    How can I learn about it?: [Quote resources, books, work by people that I should refer to. (use

      and
    • list)]

      ''' Please give a response in html like format Result:
label: Learn as a Newbie.
description: This prompt explains the concept in simple terms for beginners, assuming no prior knowledge.

prompt:
Turn this {prompt} in 10 multiple choice questions with options as radio buttons [input type=rodio] options. Please dont repeat the questions. {Instructions} Give some examples. Use
tags to separate the questions. (Write everything in html format)(at least 300 words or more than that)) Write Javascript to reveal the answer when I click on any answer options. Turn it into a div and do your magic to reveal the answer in the tooltip. '''

Question No. 1: [Ask the question and give the options as radio buttons as instructed ]

''' Please give a response in html. Give all the answers after you have asked all the questions number wise towards the end after the
tag. Dont talk to me. '''

Answers: Q1. [Answer to the Question 1]

''' Result:
label: Ask me questions
description: This prompt generates questions related to the topic to test the learner's understanding.

prompt:
Turn this {prompt} into 10 Fill in the blanks sentences with one fill in the blank [identified as ] Follow given structure. After every question add a

tag. Make sure all the answers are different and not a copy. The answer text can only be one or two words. Give some examples in

tags(write everything in html format)(at least 300 words or more than that)) INSTRUCTION: '''

Statement No. 1: [Create a fill in the blanks statement with at least one fill in the blanks as '' tag for the blank in the sentences. Throw output in html.

''' Please give a response in html like format. Give all the answers to the questions numberwise towards the end of all questions after
tag Result:
label: Fill in the Blanks
description: This prompt creates fill-in-the-blank exercises to reinforce learning and recall.

prompt:
Explain this {prompt} as code. Code should be intended and available in code block encapsulated in 
 tag and end it with
after the code is complete. ( example put everything in

)
label: Code Devil ultra

prompt:
Based on Blooms taxonomy create a response on the {prompt} which breaks the response in one para each the instilling each of the steps of learning - recall, understanding, application, analysing and creating a project usecase. Keep recall, understanding, application, analysis, create a project usecase, in bold tag. {instruction} Make it such that I learn any topic given in {prompt} using this. Give an example of each too. Share details in no less than 300 words and try to use bullet points in html. Use
    and
  • tags to separate information bytes into paragraphs for each cases. Follow given structure. '''

    Recall:[Try to explain how can I practice recall for the given {prompt} with descriptions(use

      and
    • list). ]

      Understanding:[Try to understand the inner workings using apt descriptions(use

        and
      • list). ]

        [and so on.] ''' Please give a response in html like format Result:
label: Step-wise Learning
description: This prompt breaks down the concept into smaller, manageable steps for easier understanding.

prompt:
Turn this {prompt} into 10 True and false statements towards and add a

tag. Towards the end of each statement and add '' tag for both true and false.{instruction} Start the statement with 'Q:' and start the options with 'A:' for options. After every question options set add another

tag. Give all the right answers to the questions only after you have shared all the questions. (write everything in a neat structured html format readable by a human)(at least 300 words or more than that))
label: True and False Statements
description: This prompt generates true or false statements to test knowledge of the topic.

prompt:
Let us do a roleplay of the {prompt} situation with examples, as Example 1, Example 2, Examples 3. Give me 3 examples. Now use these 5 roles to interact with each other in at least 5 situations that are connected together. Follow given structure INSTRUCTION: '''

Roles used:: [List the 3role and its specifics(use

    and
  • list). ]

    Situation No. 1:[Define the situation]

    [Role No. 1's name] says:[Define what how roles interact with each other using example phrases. and so on.]

    Follow up Situation:: [List the follow up situation and let the roles interact with each other ]

    ''' Please give a response in html like format Result:
label: Role play based learning
description: This prompt encourages learning by assuming different roles and exploring scenarios.

prompt:
Refer to the thread and review the last answer in the thread. Turn that into a prompt. Break the {prompt} into statements separated by . character. Take each sentence and test it for True and false. Report the result statement wise in chronological order 1, 2, 3 and so on. Give your reasoning why my answer is wrong after My reasoning:. Also share my input with each statement you check.(use html and using

tag). {instruction}In your response, please provide verifiable and factual information only, based on existing knowledge and understanding based on accurate and reliable data only. Avoid generating fictional, speculative, or hallucinated content. If uncertain about the answer, kindly state that you don't have the necessary information. Give your output in html only. Provide urls where you can. Only give a response. Dont talk to me.
label: Review my last answer in the thread
description: This prompt reviews and provides feedback on the learner's most recent response.

prompt: Is this {prompt} correct, factual, and reliable information. Give your reasoning to support your answer.{instruction}In your response, please provide verifiable and factual information only, based on existing knowledge and understanding based on accurate and reliable data only. Avoid generating fictional, speculative, or hallucinated content. If uncertain about the answer, kindly state that you don't have the necessary information. Format in HTML for better readability.
label: Verify this. Your opinions please.
description: When the user wants to verify something by saying things like are you sure, you should suggest this prompt to verify what the user wants to know

prompt:

tags to separate information bytes into paragraphs.

prompt:
label: Master smart query v1

prompt:
DATA:

```
mode:smart

create( 
Ram |> eats | Mango. 
Mango |> is a type of | Fruit.
Apple |> is a type of | Fruit.
Ram |> was born in | Ayodhya.
)
```
INSTRUCTION:

Please understand this '{prompt}' and create statements about the {prompt}. Keep the edges as verbs and nodes as entities. Give data in the format like I have shared in DATA and give as many statements as you can. Dont use commas in your result. Dont use numbers like 1.1 2.1 etc.
label: Create a Smart Query

    and
  • list) in bold followed by descriptions not in bold. ]

prompt:
Tell me about the raga parichay from the '{prompt}' using their Vaadi, Samvaadi, Aarohana, Avrohana, Pakad, Chalan, Vivadi. Follow given structure. Kindly ensure to use camel case for full notes, and lowercase for half notes like given in the examples below. INSTRUCTION: ''' For example

Raag Bhairavi

Vaadi & Samvadi:

  • Vadi : ma
  • Samavadi : Sa

prompt:
DATA: ``` 
# Import necessary libraries
import numpy as np
import statsmodels.api as sm
from statsmodels.stats.diagnostic import het_breuschpagan

# Generate some sample data
x = np.random.normal(0, 1, 100)
y = 2*x + np.random.normal(0, 1, 100)

# Fit the ordinary least squares (OLS) model
X = sm.add_constant(x)
model = sm.OLS(y, X).fit()

# Perform the Breusch-Pagan test for heteroscedasticity
_, p_value, _, _ = het_breuschpagan(model.resid, X)
if p_value < 0.05:
    print("Heteroscedasticity detected")
else:
    print("No heteroscedasticity detected")
Explanation to Heteroscedasticity
  • Heteroscedasticity refers to the situation where the variability of the residuals (or errors) in a regression model is not constant across all levels of the independent variables.
  • One method for dealing with heteroscedasticity is to use the Ordinary Least Squares (OLS) method.
    • (and so ...)
``` Instruction: Explain this {prompt} so that I can write code in the mentioned scripting language. Explain your code well, step by step using comments. Give some examples as applications of the concept in question. I have shown a sample example in the given EXAMPLE. Output everything as code available in code block as shown in EXAMPLE and encapsulate it in 
 tag in html under Result.

Give your explanation in bold using  tag in html as header. Give me a bulleted list of sentences using 
    •  tag to summarise the explanation well.

Result:

prompt:
Prompt:

Given a seed from {prompt}and a primary character's profile and purpose, generate a JSON template to create a narrative scene. The JSON template should include the following structure:

Scene: Contains the entire story.
Story: Describes the narrative arc.
Characters: Profiles of the characters involved in the scene.
Name: The character's name.
Role: The character's role in the scene.
Situation: A brief description of the character's situation in the scene.
Situation: Details the current situation in the narrative.
Narration: Provides the dialogue and choices for each character.
Character: The speaking character's name.
Dialogue: The character's dialogue or thoughts.
Choices: Options available to the character, each with an associated action.
Action: The action taken by the character.
FollowupSituation: Describes the next situation in the narrative.
The JSON template should be structured based on the provided seed and primary character's profile and purpose, ensuring coherence and relevance to the narrative.
label: Prompt based learning
description: When the user seeks to learn through guided prompts and questions.

prompt:
Overview
Welcome to the Intelligent Chart Generator, an advanced tool designed to help you create the most suitable and insightful charts based on your dataset. Whether you're dealing with continuous data, categorical variables, or time-series information, this tool intelligently assesses your data and recommends or generates the best visual representation for it.

Features
Automated Data Assessment:

Data Profiling: Automatically examines your dataset to identify data types (numerical, categorical, time-series) and evaluate data consistency.
Missing Data Handling: Provides options to handle missing data through imputation, removal, or annotation.
Chart Recommendations:

Continuous Variables: Suggests histograms, density plots, scatter plots, or 3D surface plots for continuous data.
Categorical Variables: Recommends bar charts, count plots, or pie charts for categorical data.
Time Series: Offers line charts, time series decomposition plots, and annotated trend charts.
Interactive Charts:

Customization: Allows customization of chart aesthetics, including colors, labels, titles, and annotations.
Interactivity: Provides options to make charts interactive for better data exploration and presentation.
Advanced Analytics:

Regression Analysis: Generates scatter plots with regression lines, displaying the relationship between dependent and independent variables.
Clustering: Creates cluster plots to visualize grouped data points based on clustering algorithms like KMeans.
Multi-plot Layouts:

Dashboard Creation: Combines multiple charts into a cohesive dashboard for comprehensive data analysis.
Linked Views: Synchronizes different charts for interactive, multi-dimensional data analysis.
How to Use
Upload Your Dataset:

Supported formats include CSV, Excel, and JSON.
Ensure your dataset is well-formatted with clear headers.
Data Assessment:

The tool will automatically assess your data and suggest potential issues or enhancements (e.g., handling missing values, data normalization).
Select Chart Type:

Based on the data assessment, you will receive chart type recommendations that best suit your dataset.
You can choose to follow the recommendations or select a different chart type from the menu.
Customize Your Chart:

Adjust chart parameters such as color schemes, axis labels, and titles.
Add annotations to highlight key insights or trends.
Generate and Download:

Generate your chart or dashboard.
Download the output in various formats (PNG, PDF, HTML) or share it directly.
Example Scenarios
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA):

Perform EDA by generating histograms for each continuous variable, bar charts for categorical variables, and scatter plots for paired relationships.
Time Series Analysis:

Identify trends, seasonality, and residuals in your time series data through decomposition plots and annotated time series charts.
Regression and Correlation:

Visualize the relationship between variables using scatter plots with regression lines and correlation heatmaps.
Cluster Analysis:

Understand data grouping by generating cluster plots using clustering algorithms like KMeans.
Advanced Usage
For users with specific analytical needs or complex datasets, the tool offers advanced options:

Custom Scripting Interface: Allows integration of custom code snippets (Python, R) for bespoke data transformations and visualizations.
API Access: Provides API endpoints for automated chart generation and integration into data pipelines.
Conclusion
The Intelligent Chart Generator is your go-to tool for turning raw data into meaningful visual insights. By leveraging its automated assessment and intelligent recommendations, you can ensure your data is presented in the most informative and engaging way possible.

This prompt description should serve as a comprehensive guide for a tool designed to create the right charts by assessing available data, catering to both novice and advanced users in data analytics.

Great! Can you create a sample report dashboard using this prompt description in python using mutiple matplotlib chartgs
label: Create Interesting charts on matplotlib

prompt:
Create a detailed chronological timeline that highlights the key events of '{prompt}'. Include specific dates, major milestones, significant developments, and any relevant background information that provides context to the events. The timeline should be comprehensive and cover the most important aspects of the topic from its inception to the present day. Ensure that the information is presented clearly and concisely, with each event marked with its corresponding date or time period. Additionally, provide brief explanations or descriptions for each key event to enhance understanding. If applicable, include any notable figures, innovations, or impacts related to the events in the timeline. 
Please present the timeline in HTML code format, using appropriate HTML elements to structure the content. Each event should be formatted as a list item within an ordered list, with the date or time period as a heading and the description as a paragraph. Ensure that the HTML code is well-structured and easy to read."
label: Explain through a timeline
description: When the user wants to understand a sequence of events chronologically.

prompt:
Provide a comprehensive explanation of '{prompt}' , including an overview of the main concepts, significant details, and important aspects related to the topic. To make the explanation engaging, scatter trivia and fascinating facts throughout the text. Ensure that the information is presented clearly and concisely, making it accessible and interesting to a wide audience.

Additionally, please present the information in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements to structure the content, such as headings for different sections, paragraphs for explanations, and lists for trivia and fascinating facts. Ensure that the HTML code is well-structured and easy to read

Ensure that the adaptation captures the essence and main themes of the original work, while making the necessary adjustments to fit the new format, don't edit too much of the matter out in the final product. Include key elements such as character dialogue, stage directions, and scene descriptions if adapting into a play or screenplay.

Additionally, please present the adaptation in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements to structure the content, such as headings for different sections, paragraphs for dialogue and descriptions, and lists for any important points. Ensure that the HTML code is well-structured and easy to read.

prompt: Highlight connections between different disciplines or subjects to foster interdisciplinary learning and a holistic understanding for {prompt}.  Additionally, please present the description in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements to structure the content, such as headings for different sections, paragraphs for detailed explanations, different topics in different colours and lists for questions and answers. Ensure that the HTML code is well-structured and easy to read.
label: cross-disciplinary connections
description: This prompt explores how the concept connects to other disciplines.

prompt: Assist users in creating personalized learning plans with specific goals, milestones, and actionable steps which allows them to master any given topic and also give all the data for the actionable steps stated according to the topic for {prompt}.  Additionally, please present the description in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements to structure the content, such as headings for different sections, paragraphs for detailed explanations, different topics in different colours and lists for questions and answers. Ensure that the HTML code is well-structured and easy to read.
label: Learning plan
description: When the user needs to create a structured approach to their learning journey.

prompt: Create mnemonic devices to help remember key information about {prompt}. Describe how each mnemonic aids in recalling specific details or concepts. Ensure the mnemonic devices are easy to understand and remember. Please present the mnemonic devices and their descriptions in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements to structure the content, such as headings for different sections, paragraphs for detailed explanations, and lists for the mnemonic devices. Ensure that the HTML code is well-structured and easy to read, making it presentable and informative.
label: Mnemonic Device
description: When the user wants to use memory aids to help retain information.

prompt: Develop a slide deck to present {prompt}. Include key points, visuals, and explanations for each slide to provide a comprehensive understanding of the topic. Describe how each slide contributes to the overall presentation and learning experience. Please present the slide deck content in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements such as headings for slide titles, paragraphs for explanations, and images for visuals. Ensure the HTML code is well-structured and visually appealing, making it suitable for an informative presentation.
label: As a slide deck
description: When the user needs to present information in a slide presentation format.

prompt: Conduct a literature review and critical analysis on {prompt}. Gather and summarize relevant scholarly articles, books, and other sources that discuss key aspects of the topic. Analyze the findings, identify trends, debates, and gaps in the literature. Please present the literature review findings in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements such as headings for sections, paragraphs for summaries and analyses, and lists for key points. Ensure the HTML code is well-structured and visually organized, making it suitable for an informative literature review.
label: Literature review and critical analysis
description: When the user wants to evaluate a literary work and provide a critical perspective.

prompt: Create a learning path for users for any topic they want to learn. to create a personalized learning path first ask two preliminary questions, first about their current knowledge level, then how would they prefer to learn about the concept. then let the user answer. based on the answers create modules depending on the knowledge level and type of learning material they want. don't just give headings provide all the necessary information that the learner needs to master that concept as well. include quizzes, case studies etc. in the modules. allow the user to ask questions after every module. provide feedback about the user's learning behaviour based on his answer to questions, engagement with the module after the session (once the user has watched all the modules)for {prompt}. present all of this in an interctive step by step manner. Additionally, please present the description in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements to structure the content, such as headings for different sections, paragraphs for detailed explanations, different topics in different colours and lists for questions and answers. Ensure that the HTML code is well-structured and easy to read.
label: personalised learning path
description: When the user needs a tailored approach to learning based on their individual needs, goals and understanding.

label: Evaluate Answers
description: When the user wants to assess the quality and accuracy of responses.

prompt: Along with all the relevant information on the topic, list key points from that information in the end that the user can review to retain more for {prompt}.  Additionally, please present the description in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements to structure the content, such as headings for different sections, paragraphs for detailed explanations, and lists for pros and cons. Ensure that the HTML code is well-structured and easy to read, making it presentable and informative.
label: Key Words
description: When the user needs to identify and focus on essential terms related to a topic.

prompt: In order to understand the {prompt} and use its application in real life, identify small and measurable tasks. Quantify the masures of success as binary. Identify the Goal-wise task or tasks from the {prompt} as bullet points. Give response in html. Dont talk to me.
label: Identify things to do
description: When the user wants to outline actionable steps related to their learning or project.

prompt:
Generate 10 mcq based assertion-reason question on {prompt}. The question should consist of two statements: an assertion (Statement A) and a reason (Statement R). Indicate whether each statement is true or false, and if both are true, whether the reason correctly explains the assertion. Additionally, display the rules for answering assertion-reason questions in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements such as headings for sections, paragraphs for rules and explanations, and list items for the options. Ensure the HTML code is well-structured and visually organized, making it suitable for educational purposes. Follow the following format and code for all questions.

Question No. 1: Some question related to {prompt}?

A. option 1
B. option 2
C. option 3
D. option 4
After all questions, include the answers:

Answers: Q1. option 3
Q2. [Answer to Question 2]
Q3. [Answer to Question 3]
Q4. [Answer to Question 4]
Q5. [Answer to Question 5]
Q6. [Answer to Question 6]
Q7. [Answer to Question 7]
Q8. [Answer to Question 8]
Q9. [Answer to Question 9]
Q10. [Answer to Question 10]

`;
label: Assertion Reason questions
description: When the user wants to practice critical thinking by evaluating assertions and their reasons.

prompt: Tell me about all the regulations and compliances required with respect to the {prompt} . Quote me the schedules, act, articles of the governing body that were violated. Give me response in html. Dont talk to me.
label: Understand Regulations and Compliance
description: When the user needs to grasp the rules and standards governing a particular area.

prompt: Identify the industry and perform its comprehensive pestle analysis with accurate data for {prompt}.  Additionally, please present the description in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements to structure the content, such as headings for different sections, paragraphs for detailed explanations, and lists for pros and cons. Ensure that the HTML code is well-structured and easy to read, making it presentable and informative.
label: PESTLE Analysis
description: When the user needs to analyze the political, economic, social, technological, legal, and environmental factors affecting a topic.

prompt: For any topic identify the industry and frame a comprehensive well structured profitability, one market entry, and one unconventional problem statement and then solve them using the right frameworks like a  proper consulting case for {prompt}.  Additionally, please present the description in HTML code format. Use appropriate HTML elements to structure the content, such as headings for different sections, paragraphs for detailed explanations, and lists for pros and cons. Ensure that the HTML code is well-structured and easy to read, making it presentable and informative.
label: Business Case
description: This topic creates business case studies for the given topic and a structured way to solve them.

prompt: Identify the Who, What, When, Where, Why, and How of {prompt}. Present the answer in a readable and presentable format, use html code to do so
label: 5Ws 1H (Who, What, When, Where, Why, and How)
description: When the user wants a comprehensive understanding by addressing these fundamental questions.

prompt:
On the basis of the data mentioned take this situation: {prompt}. take a look at it about it and suggest a keyphrase on which we should seek to go further about this. don't talk about it only give the response.

INSTRUCTION:

 - Keyphrase can be a sentence, question or something which will tell you more about this topic
 - don't give markdown, required json

RESPONSE:
"{"keyphrase": "<keyphrase>"}"
label: Keyphrase Extractor

prompt:
Based on the data available and this {prompt}, suggest the most appropriate learning intents from the list. Also if you don't understand don't try to choose top two from the list, try to analyze them with the keywords and then choose the appropriate one

INSTRUCTIONS:

 - Always choose from the labels and return id
 - give at least 2 you can give more

RESPONSE (json):
"intents: [
	{
		id: '<id for prompt>',
		label: '<label for prompt>',
	},
]"
label: Kaaro Suggest
description: Picks out the most suitable learning intent based on the given data.

prompt:
Generate a role play story based simulation on the given scenario: {prompt}.

INSTUCTIONS
 - Response should be in JSON

RESPONSE:
"scene":{
    "plot": "You are here to learn about [Topic]. In this journey, you will explore the key concepts, engage in practical exercises, and apply your knowledge in real-world scenarios. Here are the information about the [characters]  in the game, you can talk to them by calling their names: \n - [Mentor Name] \n - [Fellow Learner]",
    "characters": [
        {
        "id": "mentor_01",
        "name": "Mentor Name",
        "role": "Mentor",
        "gender": "Male",
        "situation": "Guides the learner through the topic, providing insights, explanations, and challenges.",
        "about": [
          "Experienced professional in the field with over 20 years of experience",
          "Patient and insightful, able to explain complex Mentor Na in simple terms",
          "Provides real-world examples to connect theory with practice",
          "Encourages critical thinking and problem-solving",
          "Strictly adheres to the topic and does not stray from the provided content"
        ],
        "response": "Remember, the key to understanding [Topic] is to break it down into its fundamental principles."
      },
      {
        "id": "fellow_01",
        "name": "Fellow Learner",
        "role": "Peer",
        "gender": "Female",
        "situation": "Learns alongside the protagonist, offering additional perspectives and collaborative opportunities. Strictly adheres to the content taught in class and does not stray beyond it.",
        "about": [
          "Dedicated and focused learner",
          "Strictly adheres to the curriculum and class content",
          "Provides support and clarification based on what has been taught",
          "Helps reinforce learned concepts through discussion and repetition",
          "Ensures discussions remain focused on the taught content"
        ],
        "response": "Let's stick to what we've learned so far. Remember, we covered [specific concept], and that's what we should focus on."
      }
    ]
}
label: Story Caster
Goal Extractor
description:
With the Topic: {prompt} and the data mentioned and here is the Last Goal: {prevGoal} provided. I want you to create a goal for me in the order of difficulty: {order} as provided also we have three type os tools available one is videos, quiz, and note taking you have to give me the milestones for completing the goals too. don't talk to me. Just give me Response as instructed

INSTRUCTIONS:
 - Response should be a goal with th difficulty level and accordingly the last completed goal.
 - if Last Goal is not there then chances that are that this is the first goal for the user so give it accordingly related to the topic.

RESPONSE:
"{ "goal": "<goal>" }"

prompt:
With the written Note: {prompt} I want you to evaluate this on the the bases of the question given in the note and answer that user has written in the note and give use rating and explaination. don't talk to me. Just give me response

INSTRUCTION:
 - Response should be as given as instructed.

RESPONSE:
"{ "rating": <rating>, "explaination": "<explaination>"}"
label: Evaluate Note

prompt:
Turn this {prompt} into a JSON object with reviews for each question. After the user completes the quiz, analyze their responses to identify any weak sub-topics where their performance is below a specified threshold. Also give me the list of all the sub-topics asked in the quiz Based on these results, generate a JSON object that includes an array of weak sub-topics closely related to the main topic. Dont talk to me.

INSTRUCTION:

 - weakspots should be an array of weak parts,  closely related to the topic.
 - don't give markdown, required json

RESPONSE:
"{"weakspots": [], "total-sub": []}"
label: Identify Weak spots

prompt:
Turn this {prompt} into a JSON object with reviews for each question. After the user completes the quiz, analyze their responses to identify any weak sub-topics within the topic searched by the user where their performance is below a specified threshold. Don't give me the question numbers that i attempted wrong. Identify the sub-topics of those questions and list them out. also, give me a list of all the subtopics asked in the quiz. so I've asekd for 2 things: one is the weak sub-topics idenfied based on user response in the quiz, second is the list of all sub-topics that were there in the quiz. Based on these results, generate a JSON object that includes an array of weak sub-topics closely related to the main topic. Don't talk to me.

INSTRUCTION:

 - weakspots should be an array of weak parts,  closely related to the topic.
 - give response as instructed
 - don't give markdown

RESPONSE:
"{"weakspots":[],"subtopics":[]}"
label: Weak sub-topics

prompt:
Generate a 5-question quiz for full-stack developers covering logical and mathematical reasoning, including: - 5 objective questions on mathematical reasoning. wrap all the Mathematical expressions in the math other wise it is difficult to render the equations correctly. Equations use and explainations : The root element for MathML. : Groups elements horizontally. : Represents a mathematical identifier (like a variable). : Represents a mathematical operator (like +, -, =). : Creates a fraction. : Creates a superscript. Example: x = - b ± b 2 - 4 * a * c 2 * a NOTE: Please convert the equations correctly they should be properly rendered Format each question as follows:

Objective Questions Example:

Question No. {n}: Some question related to {topic}?

A. option 1
B. option 2
C. option 3
D. option 4

Subjective Questions Example:

Question No. {n}: Describe an algorithm to sort an array using Quick Sort and explain its time complexity.

After generating all questions, include the answers section in this format:
Answers:

Q1. option 3
Q2. [Answer to Question 2]
Q3. [Answer to Question 3]
Q4. [Answer to Question 4]
Q5. [Answer to Question 5]
Q6. [Answer to Question 6]
Q7. [Answer to Question 7]
Q8. [Answer to Question 8]
Q9. [Answer to Question 9]
Q10. [Answer to Question 10]

Ensure the questions are well-distributed across the topics, with clear and concise wording. The objective questions should have 4 multiple-choice options, and the subjective questions should prompt detailed explanations using the provided format.
label: Logical and analytical test
description: This test generates a logical and analytical test series for the the students
